topic.title: Testing with telnet
topic.shortdesc: The simplest method to determine whether Couchbase Server is running is to use Telnet to connect to the server with the memcached text protocol.

body.p: Telnet must be installed on your server to connect to Couchbase Server using this method. It is supplied as standard on most platforms, or can be obtained as a separate package and installed via your operating system's standard package manager.
body.note: You do not need to use the Telnet method for communicating with your server within your application. Instead, use one of the Couchbase Server SDKs.
body.p: Connect to the server (connecting to the legacy memcached protocol using Moxi):
body.codeblock: > telnet localhost1 11211 Trying 127.0.0.1... Connected to localhost.localdomain (127.0.0.1). Escape character is '^]'.
body.p: Make sure it is responding (stats is a great way to check basic health):
body.codeblock: stats STAT delete_misses 0 STAT ep_io_num_write 0 STAT rejected_conns 0 ... STAT time 1286678223 ... STAT curr_items_tot 0 ... STAT threads 4 STAT pid 23871 ... END
get test_key VALUE test_key 0 1 a END
quit Connection closed by foreign host. >
body.p: All of the memcached protocols commands will work through Telnet.
